Name: Daisy de Santiago
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Wine glass .
Prepare garnish of seasonal berries and mint sprigs dusted with icing sugar or lime wheel (dehydrated).
STRAIN into glass filled with crushed ice.
DRIZZLE a spoon of liqueur over cocktail.
Garnish with berries and mint sprigs bouquet dusted with icing sugar (or lime wheel).
Review: Chartreuse adds subtle aromatics to this refreshing herbal Daiquiri/Daisy.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Charles H. Baker, Jr. 's 1939 The Gentleman's Companion volume II – An Exotic Drinking Book .
Nutrition: One serving of Daisy de Santiago contains 200 calories
